chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant David John Tallier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David John Tallier

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

11:07 AM Defendant David John Tallier appeared by phone.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by phone for David John Tallier.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court confirms address.  Defendant states that he is between places right now.  Atty Gumz states that the matter is resolved.
Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom.

Atty Juech states plea agreement to Counts 3 & 4.  Counts 1 & 2 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Gumz agrees and states that there is a cash bond to be applied.  Defendant agrees.

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds the defendant guilty of Counts 3 & 4 and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. Counts 1 & 2 to be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Juech makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Count 3:  Court orders 20 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence 
Report on or before December 23, 2022 by 7:00pm, clean & sober. 
Credit = 2 days
May serve in Oneida or Forest County
Pay $100 + costs = $579.00
Submit DNA sample within 30 days and pay surcharge 

Count 4:  Pay $200 + costs = $705.00
Submit DNA sample within 30 days and pay surcharge 

cash bond to be applied
Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan for balance:  $50.00/month commencing on  December 1, 2022

Counts 1 & 2 to be dismissed and read-in.

4:05 PM Defendant David John Tallier appeared by phone.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for David John Tallier.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz believes this is set for resolution.  Requests further status that could turn into plea.  No objection by Atty Burdon.
BY THE COURT:  Set for plea.
Status hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status hearing on October 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Atty Burdon files the information electronically with the Court.  Atty Dolch received a copy of the information and waives its reading.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 
Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 
bond continued

10:56 AM Defendant David John Tallier appeared by phone.  Attorney Leonie Dolch appeared by video for David John Tallier.  Attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Dolch states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
Status hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on August 22, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

3:36 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David John Tallier was on by phone.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for David John Tallier. 
Defendant was by telephone but lost connection.
Atty Gumz is projecting a waiver of Preliminary Hearing; requests a waiver of Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Set waiver of Prelim by zoom
bond continued
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Waiver of Prelim on June 14, 2022 at 10:45 am.

1:56 PM Defendant David John Tallier appeared by video.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for David John Tallier.  Attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz has an offer and discovery; needs time to speak with his client.

BY THE COURT:  Set another status
Status hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on May 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on April 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:42 AM Defendant David John Tallier appeared by video means.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video means for Defendant David John Tallier. Attorney Brian Juech appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.  Atty Gumz waives time limits.

BY THE COURT:    Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing.
bond continued  Status hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on March 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license

03:30 PM Defendant David John Tallier appeared by video means from Marquette County Jail. Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared for State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.    Court confirms address and phone.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and qualifies for Public Defender.  
  Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes.

Atty Juech requests a $500 cash bond with conditions.
Defendant states that he works but he has no cash on him; requests a signature bond.  

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $250 Cash bond with conditions:
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license  Initial appearance scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
